item.title: Discover your leadership potential with a revolutionary tool from Hogan Assessment Systems and Sirota
item.description: On July 30th at the Oasia Hotel Singapore, Dr. Tomas Chamorro-Premuzic, CEO of Hogan Assessment Systems, a leader in personality profiling and psychometric testing, along with Lewis Garrad, Managing Director Asia Pacific at Sirota, a performance consulting firm, will preview a new employee assessment model they jointly developed. Launching in the Asia Pacific market in October 2015, the Engaging Leader tool will help companies and brands better identify and develop leadership potential.

item.title: IDC Financial Insights selects the top 50 mobile innovators in the Asia-Pacific region
item.description: At the start of 2014, IDC Financial Insights released a report titled “Mobilizing Financial Services in Asia/Pacific,” which highlighted the most innovative mobile initiatives in the financial services sector. They recently shared an infographic summarizing their findings. The report identifies Australia, mainland China, Hong Kong, India, South Korea, and Singapore as frontrunners in mobile adoption within the Asia Pacific region (excluding Japan). IDC Financial Insights emphasizes a significant opportunity for mobile commerce growth, fueled by increasing mobile device usage in Asia and a strong consumer interest in mobile payments.

item.title: In the new application economy, leaders can quickly fall behind and become laggards
item.description: Lim May-Ann, Managing Director of TRPC, presented the findings of the 2016 CA Technologies Asia Pacific & Japan Application Economy Index. Singapore currently holds the top spot in the Asia Pacific and Japan region regarding the application economy. However, it faces a potential decline to fourth place in future potential, according to the inaugural Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ) Application Economy Index (AEI) 2016. This index assesses the readiness of 10 APJ markets to thrive in the digital age.

item.title: Accenture says that CEOs must lead the effort to reskill their employees
item.description: Source: Accenture website. The image illustrates the essential skills needed for the workforce of the future, highlighting technical proficiency, adaptability, and problem-solving abilities. A recent report by Accenture Strategy emphasizes that in the rapidly evolving digital world, CEOs need to prioritize reskilling their employees to ensure they remain competitive and adaptable. The report, titled “Harnessing Revolution: Creating the Future Workforce,” argues that CEOs should prioritize their employees and place them at the center of transformation to build a successful workforce for the future.
